package nov21;

public class Abstraction {

	//Abstraction - " Show only important methods to the user and hide the complex code behind them "
	// 2 types - a) Abstract class 
	//           b) Interfaces 
	
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		Game g2 = new FreeFire();
		g2.pubg();
		g2.ff();
		g2.run();
		
		Game1 game = new PUBGM();
		Game2 game2 = new PUBGM();
		game.start();
		game.stop();
		game2.shoot();
		game2.run();

	}

}

// a) Using abstract Class ;

abstract class Game {
	abstract void pubg(); 
	abstract void ff ();
	abstract void cod ();

    void run() {
        System.out.println("Player is running ... ");
    }
}
class Pubg extends Game {
    void pubg() {
        System.out.println("Best RPG Game");
    }

	@Override
	void ff() {
		
	}
	
	@Override
	void cod() {
		
	}
}
class FreeFire extends Pubg {
	void ff() {
		System.out.println("It is a child Game");
	}
	
}

// b) Using Interfaces ; ( 100 % ABSTRACTION )

interface Game1{
	void start();
	void stop();
	
}
interface Game2{
	void shoot();
	void run();
}

class PUBGM implements Game1,Game2{
	public void start() {
		System.out.println("Game has started !Get Ready ");
	}
	public void stop() {
		System.out.println("Game Has been Stopped ! ");
	}
	public void shoot() {
		System.out.println("Shoot Him");
	}
	public void run() {
		System.out.println("Run Away fast!!!");
	}
}
